summary: This is an email chain from June 25, 2020, discussing coordination between prosecutors and victim services regarding victim notification procedures for the Epstein case. The emails outline plans to notify two groups of victims: a small group of statutory victims from the indictment (via phone calls to their attorneys) and a larger group of Epstein victims (via written notification only).

persons.name: Young, N.
persons.context: FBI employee who initiated the email chain to organize a call with victim services (VSD) to coordinate victim notification procedures for the Epstein case.

events.title: Coordination call on victim notification
events.description: A scheduled call between prosecutors and victim services to discuss and finalize plans for notifying victims in the Epstein case.

keyFacts: Prosecutors planned to notify two distinct groups of victims: a small group of statutory victims from the indictment and a larger group of Epstein victims.
Notification for the small group would be via phone calls to their attorneys, while the larger group would receive written notification only to avoid confusion.
The vast majority of victims were represented by counsel, which influenced the notification procedure.
The email chain shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) and the FBI's Victim Services Division (VSD) ahead of formal notifications.
